entries.title: Moscow says it shot down 4 US-made missiles over Russia
entries.description: • One dead in strikes on Russian region near Ukraine

entries.title: Verdict reached in Harvey Weinstein sexual assault trial
Mulvaney: This criminal referral should frighten Trump most
entries.description: Mick Mulvaney, former acting chief of staff of President Trump, tells CNN's Jake Tapper why he thinks Trump should be concerned about the Jan. 6 committee's referral for a criminal charge of obstructing an official proceeding.

entries.title: Moscow says it shot down 4 US-made missiles over southern Russia
What the criminal referrals against Trump mean
First legislative response to Capitol attack nears passage
entries.description: Lawmakers reached an agreement to include in must-pass legislation a measure aimed at making it harder to overturn a certified presidential election, marking the first legislative response to the US Capitol insurrection and then-President Donald Trump's relentless pressure campaign to stay in power despite his 2020 loss.

entries.title: Ex-Trump insiders react to criminal referral for former president
entries.description: Former Trump administration aides Stephanie Grisham, Alyssa Farah Griffin, Olivia Troye and Sarah Matthews discuss the January 6 committee's criminal referral of Donald Trump to the Justice Department.

entries.title: Takeaways from Monday's Jan. 6 committee meeting
What's in the House January 6 committee report summary
entries.description: The House select committee investigating the January 6, 2021, attack on the US Capitol has concluded that former President Donald Trump was ultimately responsible for the insurrection, laying out for the public and the Justice Department a trove of evidence for why he should be prosecuted for multiple crimes.

entries.title: Hope Hicks describes conversation with Trump in newly released video
entries.description: A new video clip played by the House select committee investigating the January 6 insurrection of the US Capitol shows Hope Hicks, who previously served as a top aide to former President Donald Trump, reference Trump's baseless claims of election fraud.

entries.title: Former deputy FBI director on how the DOJ is receiving referral
entries.description: Former Deputy FBI Director Andrew McCabe explains how the Department of Justice is receiving the criminal referral of former President Donald Trump by the House select committee investigating the January 6 insurrection of the US capitol.

entries.title: Takeaways from Monday's Jan. 6 committee meeting
entries.description: The January 6 committee used its final public meeting Monday to summarize its 17-month investigation with a simple closing statement: All roads lead to Donald Trump.

entries.title: Reaction to Lionel Messi lifting the World Cup trophy wearing a bisht shows cultural fault lines of Qatar 2022
entries.description: • Video: Argentina won the World Cup. See the reaction in Buenos Aires

entries.title: Dutch prime minister apologizes for the Netherlands' role in the slave trade
entries.description: Dutch Prime Minister Mark Rutte apologized Monday for the Netherlands' "slavery past," which he said continues to have "negative effects."

entries.title: Woman arrested after breaking into Robert De Niro's home in New York City, source says
entries.description: Police in New York City arrested a woman who broke into Robert De Niro's home early Monday, according to a law enforcement source.

entries.title: Jan. 6 panel expected to announce referral of multiple criminal charges against Trump at final meeting
Sam Bankman-Fried set to drop extradition fight
entries.description: FTX founder Sam Bankman-Fried Monday morning arrived in court in the Bahamas where he is expected to drop his extradition fight, clearing a significant hurdle to return him to US soil to be prosecuted on multiple charges of fraud and conspiracy.

entries.title: Company creates candy that contains 96% real fruit and vegetables
entries.description: Amy Keller, the CEO of Climate Candy, shares why her company turns unharvested produce and other food waste into edible candy and how it can help protect the planet.

entries.title: Homicide is a leading cause of death in kids, and rates are rising, study finds
entries.description: Homicide is a leading cause of death for children in the United States, a new study says, and the overall rate has increased an average of 4.3% each year for nearly a decade.

entries.title: Elon Musk's poll results are in: He should step down, Twitter voters say
Amber Heard says she has settled defamation lawsuit with Johnny Depp
entries.description: Amber Heard has settled the defamation lawsuit with her ex-husband, Johnny Depp, according to a statement posted on her verified Instagram account.

entries.title: More than 190 countries sign landmark agreement to halt the biodiversity crisis
'Fortnite' maker Epic Games to pay $520 million in record-breaking FTC settlement
entries.description: Epic Games, maker of the hit video game "Fortnite," has agreed to pay a total of $520 million to settle US government allegations that it misled millions of players, including children and teens, into making unintended purchases and that it violated a landmark federal children's privacy law.

entries.title: Top Biden adviser's end-of-year memo celebrates president's 'strong jolt of momentum' heading into 2023
entries.description: As 2022 comes to a close, President Joe Biden's top adviser Mike Donilon has a rosy outlook on the president's political durability: Biden heads into the new year with a "strong jolt of momentum," he says.

entries.title: Tom Cruise thanks fans for supporting 'Top Gun: Maverick' -- while free-falling from a plane
entries.description: When it comes to Tom Cruise's daredevil stunts, the sky is literally the limit.

entries.title: Five injured after 'severe turbulence' on United Airlines flight into Houston
entries.description: Turbulence on a United Airlines flight traveling into Houston Monday morning sent at least five people to the hospital, airport authorities said in an email to CNN.

entries.title: World Cup commentator breaks down in tears over Argentina victory
entries.description: Andres Cantor, Chief World Cup commentator for Telemundo Deportes, shares what was going through his mind when he broke down in tears after Argentina beat France in a thrilling World Cup final.

entries.title: 2 secrets to giving gifts that people will love
entries.description: My family have never been big gift givers, so it might seem ironic that I've discovered two secrets to giving gifts that people will love.

entries.title: Doomed exoplanet will eventually spiral right into its host star
entries.description: Astronomers have come across an exoplanet with a gloomy future, spiraling closer to its host star until eventually it will be obliterated.

entries.title: The most beautiful design hotels in the Italian Dolomites
entries.description: Think apple strudel, dumplings and potatoes, ski slopes, forest foraging, mountain views, saunas and uber-chic design hotels.

entries.title: 'Freak' wave kills 3 beachgoers and injures 17 in South Africa
entries.description: Three beachgoers were killed by a "freak" wave in South Africa's coastal city of Durban on Saturday, according to local emergency medical services (EMS).

entries.title: Seeing double: Tiger Woods and son Charlie tee off in perfect symmetry wearing famous Sunday red
entries.description: It might be a rare sighting these days, but golf fans have long grown accustomed to watching Tiger Woods wear red on Sundays.

entries.title: Meta faces EU probe over antitrust concerns linked to Facebook Marketplace
entries.description: The European Union is investigating Facebook-parent Meta for possible antitrust violations stemming from the tight link between its core social media service and its online shopping platform, Facebook Marketplace.

entries.title: Veteran CNN investigative journalist Drew Griffin dead at 60
entries.description: Drew Griffin, CNN's award-winning Senior Investigative Correspondent, known for getting even the cagiest of interview subjects to engage in a story, died Saturday after a long battle with cancer, his family said. He was 60.

entries.title: Why the market is obsessed with unemployment
entries.description: As the year comes to a close, it seems that the market's focus on inflation rates are shifting to a new area of concern: Unemployment. While the Federal Reserve has taken steps to fight inflation by curbing economic growth, the full extent of the damage to the employment market is yet to be seen.

entries.title: Jan. 6 panel expected to announce referral of multiple criminal charges against Trump
Russian drones attack Kyiv, as Moscow takes another swipe at Ukraine's power grid
entries.description: At least two people were hurt and key infrastructure has been damaged in a Russian drone assault on the Ukrainian capital Kyiv, the latest attempt by Moscow to ravage Ukraine's power supplies.

entries.title: More than 190 countries sign landmark agreement to halt the biodiversity crisis
entries.description: More than 190 countries have adopted a sweeping agreement to protect nature at the United Nations' biodiversity conference in Montreal.

entries.title: Elon Musk voted out as CEO of Twitter by poll he created
entries.description: A Twitter poll created by Elon Musk asking whether he should "step down as head of Twitter" ended early Monday morning with most respondents voting in the affirmative.

entries.title: Original animatronic 'E.T.' model used in Spielberg classic sells for $2.56 million
entries.description: E.T. has a new home.

entries.title: What to watch for during the January 6 committee's final session
Trial begins for Proud Boys leaders charged with seditious conspiracy
entries.description: Leaders of the right-wing extremist Proud Boys will face trial starting Monday for their alleged conspiracy to stop Joe Biden from assuming the presidency, another test for the Justice Department's effort to punish the far-right political movement connected to fierce allies of former President Donald Trump.

entries.title: The weird ways destinations tried to get you to visit in 2022
entries.description: When they're good, they're iconic. When they're bad -- well, at least you can usually laugh. We're talking destination campaigns -- when travel hotspots make a bid for your hard-earned vacation cash by producing extravagant videos and entire websites to grab your attention.

entries.title: UK's controversial plan to deport asylum seekers to Rwanda ruled lawful by court
entries.description: The UK's controversial policy to deport some asylum seekers to Rwanda was deemed lawful by the country's High Court on Monday.

entries.title: Las Vegas Raiders stun New England Patriots on bizarre final play
entries.description: In one of the most bizarre finishes to a NFL game you're ever likely to see, the Las Vegas Raiders beat the New England Patriots 30-24 to keep their slim playoff hopes alive.

entries.title: Cyril Ramaphosa re-elected as leader of South Africa's governing African National Congress
entries.description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa has been re-elected leader of the governing African National Congress (ANC) in a party leadership contest, the ANC said on Monday.

entries.title: Lab-grown meat could be served up for dinner soon. What does it taste like?
entries.description: The meatball tastes like meat, an accomplishment in itself.

entries.title: China could see nearly a million deaths as it exits zero-Covid, study says
entries.description: China's abrupt and under-prepared exit from zero-Covid could lead to nearly 1 million deaths, according to a new study, as the country braces for an unprecedented wave of infections spreading out from its biggest cities to its vast rural areas.

entries.title: Zelensky's biggest test yet
'People thought I was crazy:' The Sicilian man upending panettone tradition
entries.description: When thinking of Sicily, it's easy to imagine white sandy beaches, timeless architecture and a host of delicacies like arancini, caponata and cannoli. But panettone would not be among the first things to come to mind.

entries.title: Opinion: Zelensky's biggest test yet
entries.description: Less than a year into his term as president of Ukraine, Volodomyr Zelensky's skills as negotiator were put to the test in his first face-to-face meeting with Russian President Vladimir Putin.

entries.title: China could see nearly a million deaths as it exits zero-Covid, study says
Chinese megacity Chongqing says people with Covid can go to work
entries.description: The sprawling Chinese metropolis of Chongqing announced Sunday that public sector employees testing positive for Covid-19 can go to work "as normal," a remarkable turnaround for a city that only weeks ago had been in the throes of a mass lockdown.

entries.title: This mechanical engineer is building robots to harvest raspberries
entries.description: Around 38% of the world's total landmass is used for agriculture -- yet hunger is worsening, and food security is in crisis, threatened by pressures including climate change, conflict and global recessions.

entries.title: Freed Russian arms dealer Viktor Bout visits occupied Ukraine
entries.description: • One dead in strikes on Russian region near Ukraine

entries.title: Ukraine shot down nine Russian drones early Monday as Moscow's forces resumed attacks on Ukraine's capital. This comes after a Russian missile barrage on Friday left many Ukrainians without light, power or heat
entries.description: • One dead in strikes on Russian region near Ukraine

entries.title: 2 injured in Russian drone attacks in Kyiv
Thai warship sinks in severe weather, leaving 33 crew missing
entries.description: A Royal Thai Navy warship sank in severe weather early Monday, leaving 33 of its crew of 106 sailors missing in stormy seas in the Gulf of Thailand, Thai authorities said.

entries.title: 5 people killed in a 'horrendous' condo shooting in Canada, police say
entries.description: Five people were killed in a shooting at a condominium in a Toronto suburb Sunday night, police said.

entries.title: Iran's government accesses the social media accounts of those it detains. Tech companies appear ill-equipped to stop it
entries.description: In between being blindfolded, locked in solitary confinement, and interrogated in a wheelchair while she was on a hunger strike following her late September arrest, Negin says she had a realization: Iranian officials were using her private Telegram chats, phone logs and text messages to incriminate her.

entries.title: Twitter deletes controversial new policy banning links to other social platforms
entries.description: Twitter deleted its controversial new policy on Sunday evening that had banned links to certain other social media platforms, less than 24 hours after the policy's initial introduction.

entries.title: CNN investigation reveals Iranian government is accessing activists' social media accounts
entries.description: A CNN investigation reveals the Iranian government is accessing the social media accounts of activists to use as evidence against them. Among these activists is Nika Shahkarami, the teenager whose death after the protests turned her into an icon. CNN's Katie Polglase reports.

entries.title: Jan. 6 committee expected to wrap up its work with a historic call for Trump's accountability
entries.description: The expected move by the January 6 committee to formally ask the Department of Justice to prosecute former President Donald Trump over his role in the US Capitol insurrection will make history, whether or not charges are ever brought.

entries.title: Mexico's Islas Marias: from prison to tourist attraction
entries.description: One of Mexico's most notorious prisons begins a new chapter this weekend as a Pacific Ocean getaway after a makeover aimed at bringing in tourists to the former penal colony.

entries.title: Pope Francis orders return to Greece of Parthenon sculptures held in Vatican
entries.description: Pope Francis has decided to return to Greece three 2,500-year-old pieces of the Parthenon that have been in the papal collections of the Vatican Museums for more than a century.

entries.title: Peru evacuating tourists from Machu Picchu
entries.description: Hundreds of tourists stranded in the ancient city of Machu Picchu are being evacuated after Peru was plunged into a state of emergency following the ousting of the country's president.

entries.title: Nepal president gives parties a week to form new government
entries.description: Nepal's president on Sunday called on the country's political parties to try to form a new government within a week after last month's inconclusive national election.

entries.title: January 6 committee report: Your guide to the missing pieces
entries.description: CNN Senior Legal Analyst Elie Honig breaks down the significance of the January 6 committee hearings, and what could happen next as the Department of Justice continues its investigation.

entries.title: Musk says he will step down as Twitter CEO if voted out by a poll he tweeted
entries.description: Twitter's mercurial new boss may be out the door after less than two months on the job, if results of a Twitter poll go against him.

entries.title: FTX's Sam Bankman-Fried to drop extradition fight
entries.description: Former FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried is expected to appear in a Bahamas court on Monday to reverse his decision to contest extradition to the US, a person familiar with the matter told CNN.

entries.title: The countdown begins for the 2026 World Cup
South Korea's middle aged men are dying 'lonely deaths'
entries.description: South Korea has a problem: thousands of people, many middle aged and isolated, are dying alone each year, often going undiscovered for days or weeks.

entries.title: Twitter bans links to other social media sites, including Facebook and emerging rivals
entries.description: Twitter will ban links to other social media services and suspend accounts that try to direct Twitter users to alternative platforms, the company announced Sunday, in an apparent attempt to stem user defections to competitors.

entries.title: At least 36 people injured, some seriously, after 'severe turbulence' on Hawaiian Airlines flight
entries.description: Crew members and passengers on a Hawaiian Airlines flight were injured after their plane encountered "severe turbulence" on a flight from Phoenix to Honolulu on Sunday, authorities said.

entries.title: 'How to make applesauce': A photograph that made time stand still
entries.description: Exploding with energy but perfectly still, Harold "Doc" Edgerton's 1964 image of a .30-caliber bullet ripping through an apple showed an otherwise unseeable moment in captivating detail. The scene took on a serene, sculptural beauty as the disintegrating apple's skin burst open against a deep blue backdrop.

entries.title: Analysis: Lionel Messi cements his place among the greats after winning epic duel against Kylian Mbappé
entries.description: Now there can be no arguments. Now there should be no debate.

entries.title: Fans in Argentina douse reporter after World Cup win
entries.description: Argentina has won the 2022 World Cup, beating France via a penalty shootout in one of the most thrilling finals in recent memory. Journalist Stefano Pozzebon is in Buenos Aires with fan reactions.
